FACT: @realDonaldTrump directed McGahn to FIRE Robert Mueller. 

And then directed McGahn to LIE about it.

.@realDonaldTrump engaged in witness tampering, pressured witnesses not to cooperate, and discouraged Cohen from cooperating by turning to “attacks and intimidation.” Nobody is above the law. #MuellerHearings

Buck: Could you charge the President with a crime after he left office?
 
Mueller: Yes.
 
Buck: You believe that you could charge the President of the United States with obstruction of justice after he left office?
 
Mueller: Yes…
 
#MuellerHearings pic.twitter.com/jmu8d4HCTK
REMINDER: @realDonaldTrump refused to be interviewed by Mueller and refused to answer any question on obstruction. We MUST uncover the facts. Nobody is above the law. #MuellerHearings

.@RepJerryNadler: @realDonaldTrump has repeatedly claimed that your report found there was no obstruction. And that it completely and totally exonerated him. But that is not what your report said, is it?
 
Robert Mueller: Correct.
 
#MuellerHearings pic.twitter.com/d6jBKE0R86
IT’S CLEAR: The #MuellerReport does not exonerate @realDonaldTrump. The report doesn’t say “no obstruction.” #MuellerHearings

(4) Trump encouraged Paul Manafort not to cooperate, appeared to offer him a pardon, and congratulated him for not “flipping”
(5) Trump also encouraged Michael Cohen not to cooperate with federal investigators, before turning on him when he, in fact, cooperated #MuellerHearings
(3) Trump directed his former campaign manager Corey Lewandowski to tell AG Jeff Sessions to limit the investigation to exclude the President and only focus on future campaigns #MuellerHearings

(1) Trump directed WH Counsel Don McGahn to fire  #Mueller
(2) Trump directed McGahn to lie and publicly deny that Trump had told him to fire Mueller #MuellerHearings

#Mueller details ten instances where there is evidence @realDonaldTrump obstructed justice.  At least five of those instances, fully laid out in the Muller Report, are clearly criminal. #MuellerHearings

Trump tried to interfere with Mueller's investigation + attempted to cover up when it was discovered. Trump officials destroyed evidence. Trump directed WH officials to lie, suppress evidence, then lied about it himself. Trump & his attorneys tried to intimidate witnesses.

Mueller indicted 13 Russian nationals + 3 Russian entities w/ interfering w/ U.S. elections; Russian military officers w/ conspiring to hack Clinton Campaign, DNC, DCCC & Russian military officers w/ conspiracy to hack computers of U.S. officials involved in 2016 U.S. election.

.@RepJerryNadler: "What about total exoneration? Did you actually totally exonerate the president?"
 
Robert Mueller: "No."
 
#MuellerHearings pic.twitter.com/J8Zv9fs1gD

The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in “sweeping and systematic fashion”—through a social media campaign, and releasing hacked documents—in an effort to secure the outcome of a Trump presidency and harm Hillary Clinton’s candidacy. #MuellerHearing

The #Mueller Report resulted in 37 criminal indictments and 7 guilty pleas. The Report revealed 10 instances where the President obstructed justice and he also repeatedly instructed people to lie to investigators for him. #NoOneIsAboveTheLaw #MuellerHearing

Russia interfered in our 2016 election.  The Trump campaign welcomed that help. Trump repeatedly tried to dismantle the investigation into this hostile foreign government’s interference through a pattern of bullying, deceit and obstruction. #NoOneIsAboveTheLaw #MuellerHearing

.@HouseJudiciary has a constitutional obligation to investigate credible allegations of misconduct. We've been doing that through pursuing the unredacted #MuellerReport and key witnesses and docs. There is no substitute for primary evidence as the Committee makes its decisions.

Robert Mueller found in his report that the Russian government attacked the 2016 US presidential election in “sweeping and systematic fashion" and detailed 10 instances of possible obstruction of the investigation of that most serious matter, as well as other possible misconduct.

Today, we will take important steps toward greater oversight of the @realDonaldTrump Administration. We have given the Administration ample time to respond to these serious reports of egregious conduct. @HouseJudiciary cannot sit idly by. There must be oversight & accountability.
